groupbuilder.group_app module

Group App Module

This module provides the main application class for the Group Builder application.

GroupApp(parent)

Main application class for the Group Builder application.
class groupbuilder.group_app.GroupApp(parent)[source]

Bases: AppFrame

Main application class for the Group Builder application.

This class handles the user interface, CSV data import/export, group configuration, and interaction with worker threads for group generation.

OnSize(event)[source]

Handle window resize events.

Adjusts grid column sizes proportionally based on the window width to ensure optimal display of information.

Parameters:

event (wx.SizeEvent) – The size event (optional)

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

__init__(parent)[source]

Initialize the GroupApp.

Sets up the application’s initial state, including UI components, data structures, and state variables for CSV handling, group configuration, and worker thread management.

Parameters:

parent (wx.Window) – Parent window

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

on_close(event)[source]

Handle window close event by stopping any running worker threads.

Ensures clean shutdown by stopping any active worker threads before the application window closes.

Parameters:

event (wx.CloseEvent) – The close event

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

on_csv_export_change(event)[source]

Handle CSV export file selection events.

Exports the current grid data to the selected CSV file path when the user selects a destination file.

Parameters:

event (wx.FileDirPickerEvent) – The file selection event

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

on_csv_load_button_click(event)[source]

Handle CSV load button click events.

Implements the workflow for loading person data from a CSV file: 1. Show file picker dialog 2. Show column selection dialog 3. Show group configuration dialog 4. Start worker thread with the configured data

Parameters:

event (wx.CommandEvent) – The button click event

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

on_gconfig_button_click(event)[source]

Handle group configuration button click events.

Opens a dialog for configuring groups without CSV data, then starts the worker thread with the specified configuration. Uses generic person names (Person 1, Person 2, etc.) instead of CSV data.

Parameters:

event (wx.CommandEvent) – The button click event

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

on_pause_button_click(event)[source]

Handle pause button click events.

Toggles the pause state of the worker thread, providing visual feedback in the UI about the current state.

Parameters:

event (wx.CommandEvent) – The button click event

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

on_round_generated(round_data, round_number, max_rounds, paused)[source]

Callback method called when a round is generated by the worker thread.

Updates the UI with the new round data, including progress indicators and the display of the latest generated round.

Parameters:

  • round_data (list[frozenset[int]]) – The generated round data

  • round_number (int) – Current round number

  • max_rounds (int) – Maximum number of rounds

  • paused (bool) – Whether the worker thread is paused

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

on_round_selector_enter(event)[source]

Handle round selection input events.

Validates and processes user input in the round selector control, ensuring the selected round exists before updating the display.

Parameters:

event (wx.CommandEvent) – The event triggered when entering a value in the round selector

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

render_grid(page)[source]

Render the grid with group assignments for a specific round.

Populates the grid with group assignments from the specified round, displaying group labels and person names in their assigned groups.

Parameters:

page (int) – Round index to display (0-based)

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

setup_status()[source]

Set up the UI status before starting group generation.

Resets status controls to their initial state and prepares the UI for a new round generation process.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

start_worker_thread()[source]

Start the worker thread for generating rounds.

Creates and starts a new RoundWorkerThread with the current configuration if no worker thread is currently running.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

stop_worker_thread()[source]

Stop the worker thread if it’s running.

Safely terminates the worker thread and updates the UI to reflect the stopped state.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

update_status(paused)[source]

Update the UI status based on worker thread state.

Updates status indicators and controls to reflect the current state of the worker thread (running, paused, or stopped).

Parameters:

paused (bool) – Whether the worker thread is paused

Returns:

None

Return type:

None
